attributes.action: Reduce the retirement age for employees of the ambulance service nhs trust
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: At present day the police service and the fire service employees can retire at 55 years of age with full pension rights, emergency frontline ambulance employees are not allowed to retire and claim full a pension until 60 years of age.Both police and fire services are acknowledged as emergency services where as the ambulance service is regarded as an essential service thus not afforded the same rights. The two emergency services do pay more into there pension schemes but ambulance staff are not given the opportunity and would welcome a change to these outdated regulations.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
